SectionTitle: 7.9: Daily Work Plan Meetings & Tool Box Talk
SectionNotes: Managers and Masters, supported by the ship’s Safety Officer and the Senior Officers, ensure and monitor the proper implementation of safe working practices.

Responsibilities: Arrange/head daily work meetings, attended by all personnel who will be involved in the works scheduled to be conducted within each day.
Discuss already planned works or any additional work since the last meeting.
Consider any interdepartmental and safety conflicts of the planned work.
Ensure that the actions of one ship's Department do not adversely affect any other.
Emphasize on safety precautions, hazard analysis/RA, PPE, work permits, isolation and tagging arrangements and any other required safe working practices and give any special instructions to crew.
Carry out toolbox talk before any operation/task.
Post the daily meeting minutes with a work plan (form 021.7.9.PERMIT.Daily Work Planning Meeting Minutes) detailing jobs and responsibilities in the common public room(s).
Address and prioritize scheduled works considering the work significance, urgency and complexity.
Account for any unscheduled priority works and critical equipment maintenance.
Identify possible work complications such as unforeseen component damage.
Verify availability of required spares, condition of equipment and special tools.
Consider the ship’s trading schedule and personnel allocation within work/rest hour limits.
If shore personnel or specialists are required, inform the Office timely to avoid delays.
NEVER attempt any jobs unless discussed in the daily meeting.

If something unexpected occurs, discuss all safety aspects and start the work under a Senior Officer's supervision, subject to issuance of an unscheduled work permit (form 012.7.9.PERMIT.Unscheduled Work Permit), if required.

Topics.Description: A discussion among the members of a working team focusing on safety issues related to the intended work.
Details: Conducted at any time and at anyone’s initiative but preferably by the team’s leader at the worksite or a comfortable location before beginning the work.
Normally not minuted, but may be documented in form 021.7.9.PERMIT.Daily Work Planning Meeting Minutes.

Questions.QuestionText: 1. What is the main purpose of the Daily Work Plan Meeting on board?
Options: A. To distribute personal protective equipment to all crew members
B. To discuss and schedule all planned and additional works safely and efficiently
C. To report accidents and incidents to the office
D. To perform maintenance checks on safety equipment
Questions.Reason: The Daily Work Plan Meeting ensures all scheduled and additional works are safely discussed, coordinated, and prioritized among departments.

Questions.QuestionText: 2. Who is responsible for arranging and heading the Daily Work Plan Meeting?
Options: A. Chief Engineer
B. Safety Officer
C. Master
D. Senior Officer of each department
Questions.Reason: The Master arranges and heads the meeting to ensure all operations are properly coordinated and safe working practices are followed.

Questions.QuestionText: 3. What should be done if an unexpected job arises during the day?
Options: A. Start work immediately to save time
B. Proceed without informing anyone
C. Discuss safety aspects and start under Senior Officer supervision after obtaining an unscheduled work permit
D. Wait until the next scheduled meeting
Questions.Reason: Unscheduled jobs must be discussed for safety and carried out under supervision with a valid permit to ensure compliance with safety procedures.

Questions.QuestionText: 4. What does a Toolbox Talk mainly focus on?
Options: A. Job progress reporting
B. Safety issues related to the intended work
C. Crew welfare and rest hours
D. Ship’s trading schedule
Questions.Reason: A Toolbox Talk is a short discussion focusing on safety issues related to the specific task about to be performed.

Questions.QuestionText: 5. Where should the Daily Work Plan Meeting minutes be posted?
Options: A. On the ship’s bridge
B. In the engine control room
C. In common public room(s)
D. Only in the Master’s office
Questions.Reason: Meeting minutes with job details and responsibilities should be posted in public areas to ensure visibility to all crew members.
